docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 -- President Eisenhower will report to the nation on television and radio Sunday evening or the purpose of his 15,560-mile tour of South American capitals that is to begin Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 -- President Eisenhower will report to the nation on television and radio Sunday evening or the purpose of his 15,560-mile tour of South American capitals that is to begin Monday.
docs.abstract: Eisenhower to rept to US via radio-TV on tour aims; scoffs at repts of danger or hostile demonstrations expected by some, news conf

headline.main: PRESIDENT SCOFFS AT TOUR DANGERS; Says He Cannot Worry -- Will Give TV-Radio Report Prior to Departure

byline.original: By FELIX BELAIR Jr.Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 17 -- The draft of a treaty setting up a Latin-American free trade zone was agreed upon today by the delegates of seven countries.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 17 -- The draft of a treaty setting up a Latin-American free trade zone was agreed upon today by the delegates of seven countries.
docs.abstract: 7 nations agree on free-trade area draft pact; accord reached on 6-yr notice of withdrawal

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 18 -- The foreign minis- ters of seven Latin-American countries signed today a treaty for a free trade zone linking their nations' economies. The countries involved are Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru and...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 18 -- The foreign minis- ters of seven Latin-American countries signed today a treaty for a free trade zone linking their nations' economies. The countries involved are Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Paraguay, Peru and Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Mex, Paraguay, Peru and Uruguay sign pact, Montevideo, setting up free-trade area, providing for cutting all curbs on 75% of trade in area within 12 yrs; prospects for US cooperation outlined; operating plans discussed

headline.main: 7 Latin Nations Sign Pact To Form Common Market; LATIN LANDS SIGN TRADE-BLOC PACT

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 19 -- British public opinion welcomes the sixty-day reprieve for Caryl Chessman, but on the assumption that it ends the threat of execution.

headline.main: CHESSMAN'S STAY HAILED IN EUROPE; South America Also Jubilant -- Many Assume Threat of Execution Has Ended

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 19 -- An unexpected and dramatic sixty-day reprieve by Gov. Edmund G. Brown enabled Caryl Chessman to see a blue sky today instead of a green-walled execution chamber.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 19 -- An unexpected and dramatic sixty-day reprieve by Gov. Edmund G. Brown enabled Caryl Chessman to see a blue sky today instead of a green-walled execution chamber.

headline.main: U.S INTERVENTION IN CHESSMAN CASE A FACTOR IN STAY; State Department Message to Gov. Brown Arouses Protests in Congress U.S. INTERVENTION HELPED CHESSMAN

byline.original: By LAWRENCE E. DAVIESSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: A dream began to come true in Latin America this week when the foreign ministers of seven nations signed a treaty for a free trade zone linking a portion of their economies. This is not exactly the first step, as three of the Central American nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: A dream began to come true in Latin America this week when the foreign ministers of seven nations signed a treaty for a free trade zone linking a portion of their economies. This is not exactly the first step, as three of the Central American nations made an even more extensive agreement earlier this month, but the "big seven" are certainly far more important in every respect.

docs.snippet: ALONG career of sober dedication to improving inter-American relations has had a startling result for Roy Richard Rubottom Jr. He has suddenly become a key name in a criminal case that has reverberated around the world.
docs.lead_paragraph: ALONG career of sober dedication to improving inter-American relations has had a startling result for Roy Richard Rubottom Jr. He has suddenly become a key name in a criminal case that has reverberated around the world.
